title: What is IPC?
text: The Indian Penal Code is the main criminal code of India that defines offenses and prescribes punishments.

title: When was IPC enacted?
text: The Indian Penal Code was enacted in 1860 and came into force in 1862.

title: What is IPC Section 107?
text: IPC Section 107 defines abetment, which includes instigating or aiding the commission of a crime.

title: What is IPC Section 120B?
text: IPC Section 120B deals with punishment for criminal conspiracy.

title: What is IPC Section 141?
text: IPC Section 141 defines unlawful assembly as an assembly of five or more persons with a common unlawful objective.

title: What is IPC Section 143?
text: IPC Section 143 prescribes punishment for being a member of an unlawful assembly.

title: What is IPC Section 146?
text: IPC Section 146 defines rioting as the use of force or violence by an unlawful assembly.

title: What is IPC Section 149?
text: IPC Section 149 makes every member of an unlawful assembly liable for offenses committed in pursuit of the common object.

title: What is IPC Section 191?
text: IPC Section 191 defines giving false evidence, commonly known as perjury.

title: What is IPC Section 193?
text: IPC Section 193 prescribes punishment for giving false evidence in judicial proceedings.

title: What is IPC Section 299?
text: IPC Section 299 defines culpable homicide.

title: What is IPC Section 300?
text: IPC Section 300 defines murder and circumstances under which culpable homicide amounts to murder.

title: What is IPC Section 302?
text: IPC Section 302 prescribes punishment for murder including death or life imprisonment.

title: What is IPC Section 304?
text: IPC Section 304 prescribes punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder.

title: What is IPC Section 307?
text: IPC Section 307 deals with attempt to murder.

title: What is IPC Section 323?
text: IPC Section 323 prescribes punishment for voluntarily causing hurt.

title: What is IPC Section 325?
text: IPC Section 325 deals with punishment for causing grievous hurt.

title: What is IPC Section 341?
text: IPC Section 341 defines wrongful restraint.

title: What is IPC Section 342?
text: IPC Section 342 defines wrongful confinement.

title: What is IPC Section 354?
text: IPC Section 354 deals with assault or criminal force to outrage the modesty of a woman.

title: What is IPC Section 375?
text: IPC Section 375 defines rape and its conditions.

title: What is IPC Section 376?
text: IPC Section 376 prescribes punishment for rape.

title: What is IPC Section 378?
text: IPC Section 378 defines theft.

title: What is IPC Section 379?
text: IPC Section 379 prescribes punishment for theft.

title: What is IPC Section 383?
text: IPC Section 383 defines extortion.

title: What is IPC Section 384?
text: IPC Section 384 prescribes punishment for extortion.

title: What is IPC Section 390?
text: IPC Section 390 defines robbery.

title: What is IPC Section 392?
text: IPC Section 392 prescribes punishment for robbery.

title: What is IPC Section 403?
text: IPC Section 403 deals with dishonest misappropriation of property.

title: What is IPC Section 405?
text: IPC Section 405 defines criminal breach of trust.

title: What is IPC Section 406?
text: IPC Section 406 prescribes punishment for criminal breach of trust.

title: What is IPC Section 415?
text: IPC Section 415 defines cheating.

title: What is IPC Section 420?
text: IPC Section 420 prescribes punishment for cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property.

title: What is IPC Section 463?
text: IPC Section 463 defines forgery.

title: What is IPC Section 465?
text: IPC Section 465 prescribes punishment for forgery.

title: What is IPC Section 468?
text: IPC Section 468 deals with forgery for the purpose of cheating.

title: What is IPC Section 471?
text: IPC Section 471 deals with using forged documents as genuine.

title: What is IPC Section 498A?
text: IPC Section 498A deals with cruelty against married women by husband or relatives.

title: What is IPC Section 504?
text: IPC Section 504 deals with intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of peace.

title: What is IPC Section 506?
text: IPC Section 506 deals with criminal intimidation.
